key_title: Key to the species of Lasiopetalum

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the genera of Sterculiaceae

source.author: Short, P.S.
source.title: Sterculiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Short, P.S. (1996). Sterculiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Style glabrous or with one or several scattered hairs; leaves somewhat rigid, undersurface with a dense, somewhat matted vestiture of hairs; flowers pink
Style with prominent clusters of reflexed hairs; leaves somewhat flaccid, undersurface with a sparse vestiture of hairs; flowers more or less white; near-coastal in south-west only
Inner surface of calyx more or less glabrous
Inner surface of calyx with indumentum of stellate hairs
Flowers distinctly stalked in a loose inflorescence; leaves ovate or lanceolate, 5–12 cm long, 1–4 cm wide, margins flat; chiefly mallee areas
Flowers subsessile in a dense, compact inflorescence; leaves mainly oblong or lanceolate, 3–8 cm long, 0.5–2 cm wide, margins flat or recurved; not in mallee areas
Leaves mostly linear or narrowly oblong, 1.5–6 cm long, 0.2–0.7 mm wide; flowers in loose inflorescences
Leaves mostly ovate to lanceolate, 2–12 cm long, usually more than 1 cm wide; flowers in dense, nearly sessile clusters
